page.title: 19Interview with W.P.C.White
page.content: W.P.C. Tina White has been a policewoman for ten and a half years. She trained for 2 years as a probationer.When she finished her 2 years she had to do 10 weeks schooling before becoming a policewoman.She is an area constable which means she looks after Ashchurch and Northway. She works from Tewkesbury Police Station. 4 vehicles work from Tewkesbury Station:1 motor cycle, 2 small Ford vans and 1 patrol car.There are 4 women, 27 other constables, 4 sergeants, 1 inspector and 1 chief inspector and 6 dogs at Tewkesbury Station.She used to work at Cheltenham C.I.D. where she worked for two months on an abduction case and arrested a murderer. She carries a radio and a pair of handcuffs,but she does not usually have a truncheon. She works an 8 hour shift but sometimes more.
